Reason: The 'bucket.size' configuration option is performance-sensitive. This is because the 'bucket.size' directly affects the number of buckets in each direction, which in turn impacts the overall rendering performance at the system level. The code snippet related to 'bucket.size' involves operations like clamping the size, computing bucket order, and calculating anti-aliasing stepping sizes, all of which are time-expensive and memory-expensive operations. These operations contribute significantly to the execution time and memory consumption of the rendering process, leading to notable performance variations at the system level.
